summary: Internal FBI email chain from October 2021 discussing the process of accessing and exporting documents related to the Epstein/Maxwell case, specifically communications with victims and their attorneys. The emails involve coordination between the New York Field Office and the Victim Services Division to comply with a request from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office working on the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking desk, involved in accessing and downloading case documents.

persons.name: Program Manager
persons.role: Program Manager, Victim Program Management Unit
persons.context: FBI employee in the Victim Services Division, coordinating the response to a request from the U.S. Attorney's Office for victim and attorney communications.

persons.name: Program Support Analyst
persons.role: Program Support Analyst, Victim Outreach Support & Strategy
persons.context: FBI employee in the Victim Services Division, handling the export of email communications from the VictimServices@fbi.gov mailbox.

connections.description: Both are FBI employees coordinating on the Epstein/Maxwell case document request, with the Program Manager providing guidance and the Special Agent working on accessing documents.
Both work in the FBI Victim Services Division, with the Program Manager requesting assistance from the Program Support Analyst to export email communications.

events.title: Password provided for document access
events.description: An FBI employee provides the password 'SunSh!ne$5' to access documents related to the Epstein/Maxwell discussion.

events.title: Follow-up on document export request
events.description: A Program Support Analyst follows up on a request to export the Epstein folder from the VictimServices@fbi.gov mailbox, noting the export must be done on-site.

events.title: Request to export Epstein email folder
events.description: An FBI employee requests the export of the Epstein folder from the VictimServices@fbi.gov mailbox to provide all email communications with victims to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Inquiry about victim and attorney communications
events.description: An FBI employee from New York inquires about obtaining an accurate list of victims, the Victim Specialists who assisted them, and all email contacts with victims and their attorneys.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office requested all FBI email communications with victims and their attorneys related to the Epstein/Maxwell case.
FBI Victim Services Division maintained a folder of victim and attorney communications in the VictimServices@fbi.gov mailbox and a SharePoint page.
The export of the Epstein email folder required on-site access and was to be provided as a data file to the USAO.
Victim Notification System (VNS) letters were sent directly to victims' attorneys and could be used to identify which Victim Specialists worked with specific victims.
The email chain reveals internal FBI coordination and procedural steps to comply with a legal request for evidence in the Epstein/Maxwell case.
